I doubt this is a CDT problem. IDEApplication is the main driver out of the
Eclipse platform. Do you get the same thing when the CDT is not installed?

(In reply to comment #1)
> I doubt this is a CDT problem. IDEApplication is the main driver out of the
> Eclipse platform. Do you get the same thing when the CDT is not installed?

This appear only in one of our platform with CDT, we suspect that something went
wrong when we install CDT, on another system running eclipse 3.1 with CDT , the
problem doesn't appear.
The only difference between the 2 systems is java version .

(In reply to comment #2)
> (In reply to comment #1)
> > I doubt this is a CDT problem. IDEApplication is the main driver out of the
> > Eclipse platform. Do you get the same thing when the CDT is not installed?
> 
> This appear only in one of our platform with CDT, we suspect that something went
> wrong when we install CDT, on another system running eclipse 3.1 with CDT , the
> problem doesn't appear.
> The only difference between the 2 systems is java version .

a file in eclipse hierarchie might have been modified after installing CDT.
I reinstall eclipse and CDT and everything seems to be ok

I have exactly this problem right now. It is only affecting new users (i.e. users that have not yet used Eclipse) existing users are fine. Erasing ~/.eclipse allows the user to use eclipse again, once. I hope a Eclipse/CDT reinstall fixes it but I don't see how Eclipse or the CDT can have been corrupted. The real bug is that there is inadequate info in the log.
